# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:, :ym] = map(dt -> string(Dates.year(dt)) * string(Dates.month(dt)), df.dt)
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a lambda expression to each element of the `dt` column in the DataFrame `df`. The lambda expression extracts the year and month from the `DateTime` object using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions, then concatenates them together as an integer string in the format "yyyymm". Finally, it assigns this new column to `df[:, :ym]`.

Please note that the `map` function returns a lazy iterator by default, so if you want to ensure that the transformation is applied to the entire DataFrame, you should either use `collect(map(...))` or assign the result directly to the new column as shown above.
